original: @43b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @43b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: de wa aa ti sha ya sto tra:/
analyzed: de wa aa ti sha ya sto tra:/
translated: Devata-atishta-stotra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: lha las phul du byung bar bstod pa /
analyzed: lha las phul du byung bar bstod pa /
translated: Praise of the One More Excellent than the Gods

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Tathagatas!

original: bcom ldan bde gshegs mngon sum ma gyur khyab 'jug min //
analyzed: bcom ldan bde gshegs mngon sum ma gyur khyab 'jug min //
translated: The Blessed One, the Sugata, is not manifest; Vishnu is not so.

original: tshangs pa ma yin lha chen po yang ma mthong ste ;
analyzed: tshangs pa ma yin lha chen po yang ma mthong ste ;
translated: Brahma is not so; nor is Mahadeva seen.

original: / de dag gi gzugs mthu dang spyod pa bsam pa rnams //
analyzed: / de dag gi gzugs mthu dang spyod pa bsam pa rnams //
translated: Their forms, powers, and deeds,

original: thos nas su la yon tan yod dam med pa dpyad //
analyzed: thos nas su la yon tan yod dam med pa dpyad //
translated: having heard of them, one examines who has what qualities and who does not.

original: khyab 'jug dpung drag mtshon cha dbyug to thags par brtson //
analyzed: khyab 'jug dpung drag mtshon cha dbyug to thags par brtson //
translated: Vishnu, with his powerful weapons, is intent on his bow.üîΩThe Great God wears garlands of human skulls.

original: lha chen mi yi thod pa'i phreng ba rnams kyi bzhag / sangs rgyas cha lugs gcig tu zhi ba'i phul phyin na //
analyzed: lha chen mi yi thod pa'i phreng ba rnams kyi bzhag / sangs rgyas cha lugs gcig tu zhi ba'i phul phyin na //
translated: The Buddha's appearance is utterly peaceful.

original: nye bar zhi dang ma zhi gang la mchod par bya //
analyzed: nye bar zhi dang ma zhi gang la mchod par bya //
translated: To whom should one make offerings, the peaceful or the wrathful?

original: khyab 'jug gis ni 'thab dka' la sogs rigs rnams brlag par gyur //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gis ni 'thab dka' la sogs rigs rnams brlag par gyur //
translated: Vishnu destroyed the Kaurava clan and so on.

original: lha chen pos ni grong khyer sum brtsegs bcom par gyur zhes grag / skem byed kyis kyang mdung thung 'jebs bsnun krung krung bsad par gyur //
analyzed: lha chen pos ni grong khyer sum brtsegs bcom par gyur zhes grag / skem byed kyis kyang mdung thung 'jebs bsnun krung krung bsad par gyur //
translated: and that the emaciated one killed the peacock with a sharp spear.

original: sangs rgyas nyag gcig 'gro la sman pa thams cad mdzad pa lags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyag gcig 'gro la sman pa thams cad mdzad pa lags //
translated: The Buddha alone is the physician for the world, performing all benefits.

original: nga yis 'di la gnod bya 'di nyid bsrung bya 'di //
analyzed: nga yis 'di la gnod bya 'di nyid bsrung bya 'di //
translated: ‚ÄúI will harm this one,‚Äù ‚ÄúI will protect this one,‚Äù

original: gsad bya zhes pa lha yi mchog gi gzhung lugs yin //
analyzed: gsad bya zhes pa lha yi mchog gi gzhung lugs yin //
translated: ‚ÄúI will kill this one‚Äù‚Äîthis is the system of the supreme god.

original: sangs rgyas la ni dgra dang mdza' bshes mi mnga' bar //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ni dgra dang mdza' bshes mi mnga' bar //
translated: The Buddha has no enemies or friends,

original: nges par legs dang mngon par mtho bas phan 'dogs mdzad //
analyzed: nges par legs dang mngon par mtho bas phan 'dogs mdzad //
translated: but benefits everyone with definite goodness and high status.

original: @44a * // khyab 'jug chig ni 'dod chags la sogs skyon rnams bskyed //
analyzed: @44a * // khyab 'jug chig ni 'dod chags la sogs skyon rnams bskyed //
translated: Vi·π£·πáu produces faults such as desire,

original: lha chen po yi byed spyod gang yin smyon pa bzhin //
analyzed: lha chen po yi byed spyod gang yin smyon pa bzhin //
translated: and the behavior of the great god is like that of a madman.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyes pa ma lus sel mdzad na //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyes pa ma lus sel mdzad na //
translated: If the TathƒÅgata removes all faults,

original: su zhig ston pa chen por 'os pa dpyad par gyis //
analyzed: su zhig ston pa chen por 'os pa dpyad par gyis //
translated: consider who is worthy to be the great teacher.

original: gang zhig brtse med gzhan la gnod par brtson pa dang // gang la 'gro ba dag ni skyabs su song gyur pa //
analyzed: gang zhig brtse med gzhan la gnod par brtson pa dang // gang la 'gro ba dag ni skyabs su song gyur pa //
translated: and who is it that is the refuge of the world?

original: 'dod chags bcas dang gang zhig 'dod chags rnam bral ba //
analyzed: 'dod chags bcas dang gang zhig 'dod chags rnam bral ba //
translated: Who is it that is endowed with desire, and who is it that is free from desire?

original: de las gang zhig 'di na mchod bya soms te smros //
analyzed: de las gang zhig 'di na mchod bya soms te smros //
translated: Think about this and tell me, who is it that is to be worshipped here?

original: brgya byin rdo rje thogs shing stobs can gshol thogs khyab 'jug 'khor lo'i mtshon thogs dang // skem byed mdung thung thogs shing lha chen rtse gsum mtshon thogs dur khrod gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: brgya byin rdo rje thogs shing stobs can gshol thogs khyab 'jug 'khor lo'i mtshon thogs dang // skem byed mdung thung thogs shing lha chen rtse gsum mtshon thogs dur khrod gnas gyur pa //
translated: Indra holds a vajra, Vishnu a plow, Shiva a trident, and Yama a staff in the charnel ground.

original: de dag byis pa snying brtse med pa sna tshogs mtshon thogs sdug bsngal 'jigs pas nyen //
analyzed: de dag byis pa snying brtse med pa sna tshogs mtshon thogs sdug bsngal 'jigs pas nyen //
translated: They are merciless children, holding various weapons, tormented by the fear of suffering.

original: rtag tu srog chags 'joms par brtson pa de la mkhas pa su zhig 'dud par byed //üîΩgang zhig rtse gsum mi bsnams chags bcas mchan na chung ma med //
analyzed: rtag tu srog chags 'joms par brtson pa de la mkhas pa su zhig 'dud par byed // gang zhig rtse gsum mi bsnams chags bcas mchan na chung ma med //
translated: What wise person would bow down to them, who are always striving to destroy living beings?üîΩHe who does not hold a trident, who is not attached, who has no wife in his lap,

original: 'khor lo mdung thung drag po dang ni bshol mi bsnams //
analyzed: 'khor lo mdung thung drag po dang ni bshol mi bsnams //
translated: who does not hold a wheel, a spear, a club, or a sword,

original: nyon mongs rnam grol mkhas pa gzhan la phan 'dogs rnam par brtson //
analyzed: nyon mongs rnam grol mkhas pa gzhan la phan 'dogs rnam par brtson //
translated: He is skilled in liberating from afflictions, and strives to benefit others.

original: 'jig rten skyabs gyur drang srong de la 'dir ni skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyabs gyur drang srong de la 'dir ni skyabs su mchi //
translated: I go for refuge here to that Sage, the protector of the world.

original: lha chen 'dod chags dbang gyur ngo tsha spangs shing co 'dri chung ma len par byed //
analyzed: lha chen 'dod chags dbang gyur ngo tsha spangs shing co 'dri chung ma len par byed //
translated: The great god is under the power of desire, abandoning shame and taking a wife who is laughing.

original: khyab 'jug lhag par gtum zhing byas pa chud gzon skem byed rang gi gnyen yang gsod //
analyzed: khyab 'jug lhag par gtum zhing byas pa chud gzon skem byed rang gi gnyen yang gsod //
translated: Vishnu is extremely cruel, wasting what is done, drying up, and killing his own relatives.

original: dka' bzlog khro zhing ma he gsod byed ma mo rnams ni mi yi sha tshil za //
analyzed: dka' bzlog khro zhing ma he gsod byed ma mo rnams ni mi yi sha tshil za //
translated: The Rudras are angry and kill buffaloes, the Matrikas eat human flesh and fat.

original: log 'dren cha dang che yi stobs bcu ldan la nyes pa chung ngu'ang 'ga' mi mnga' //
analyzed: log 'dren cha dang che yi stobs bcu ldan la nyes pa chung ngu'ang 'ga' mi mnga' //
translated: The Mara of the aggregates and the Mara of the afflictions have the ten powers, but they do not possess even the slightest fault.

original: bcom ldan de ni bdag gi gnyen min mu stegs gzhan ngag dgra ma yin //
analyzed: bcom ldan de ni bdag gi gnyen min mu stegs gzhan ngag dgra ma yin //
translated: The Bhagavan is not my relative, nor is he an enemy of other tirthikas.

original: de dag gi spyod gzhan yang mngon sum gyur par ma mthong ste //
analyzed: de dag gi spyod gzhan yang mngon sum gyur par ma mthong ste //
translated: I do not see their conduct as manifest,

original: tshig dang spyod pa dag gis so so'i khyad par thos pa las //
analyzed: tshig dang spyod pa dag gis so so'i khyad par thos pa las //
translated: but from hearing the individual distinctions in words and conduct,

original: sangs rgyas yon tan phul du phyin la dad phyir bdag rten lags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yon tan phul du phyin la dad phyir bdag rten lags //
translated: I take refuge in the Buddha, who is endowed with the highest qualities.

original: bde bar gshegs pa bdag gi pha min mu stegs gzhan dag dgra ma yin //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa bdag gi pha min mu stegs gzhan dag dgra ma yin //
translated: The Sugata is not my father, nor are the non-Buddhist teachers my enemies.

original: de bzhin gshegs des bdag nor ma stsal gzegs zan sogs kyis cang ma phrogs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs des bdag nor ma stsal gzegs zan sogs kyis cang ma phrogs //
translated: The Tathagata has not given me any wealth, nor have the Jains and others taken anything from me.

original: 'on kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan de ni gcig tu 'gro la sman mdzad gsung //
analyzed: 'on kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan de ni gcig tu 'gro la sman mdzad gsung //
translated: Nevertheless, the Bhagavat Buddha is said to be the sole benefactor of beings.

original: dri med dri ma thams cad sel ba gang yin de la @44b bdag dang lags //
analyzed: dri med dri ma thams cad sel ba gang yin de la @44b bdag dang lags //
translated: I am devoted to him, the stainless one who removes all stains.

original: gang zhig rtag tu phan dgyes rgyun du 'gro la phan 'dogs mdzad //
analyzed: gang zhig rtag tu phan dgyes rgyun du 'gro la phan 'dogs mdzad //
translated: He who is always benevolent, who constantly benefits beings,üîΩhe who brings happiness to the world tormented by manifold suffering,

original: gang zhig 'gro ba sdug bsngal rnam mang gdungs pa bde mdzad dang // gang zhig shes bya mtha' dag lag mthil bzhin du gsal mkhyen pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gro ba sdug bsngal rnam mang gdungs pa bde mdzad dang // gang zhig shes bya mtha' dag lag mthil bzhin du gsal mkhyen pa //
translated: he who clearly knows all objects of knowledge as if they were in the palm of his hand,

original: drang srong mnyam med rgyu mnga' de la glo ba dad par gyur //
analyzed: drang srong mnyam med rgyu mnga' de la glo ba dad par gyur //
translated: I have faith in that sage, unequaled and endowed with the ten powers.üîΩWhether with sincere faith, or with whatever joy,

original: snying nas dad dam ji ltar dga' ba dang // the tshom gyis sam gzhan gyi ngor yang rung //
analyzed: snying nas dad dam ji ltar dga' ba dang // the tshom gyis sam gzhan gyi ngor yang rung //
translated: or with doubt, or for the sake of others,

original: gang zhig thub dbang zla ba der phyag byed //
analyzed: gang zhig thub dbang zla ba der phyag byed //
translated: He who pays homage to that Lord of Sages, the Moon,

original: des ni lha yi bde ba phun tshogs thob //
analyzed: des ni lha yi bde ba phun tshogs thob //
translated: Will attain the perfect bliss of the gods.

original: gna' sngon khyab 'jug 'di yis 'jig rten skye rgan na 'chi'i dbang gyur thob nas su //
analyzed: gna' sngon khyab 'jug 'di yis 'jig rten skye rgan na 'chi'i dbang gyur thob nas su //
translated: In the past, Vishnu, having attained the world of birth, old age, sickness, and death,

original: mi rnams bskyab phyir rmad byung blo yis snying brtse brtson pas sh'akya'i rigs rgyas par //
analyzed: mi rnams bskyab phyir rmad byung blo yis snying brtse brtson pas sh'akya'i rigs rgyas par //
translated: Out of compassion and with an extraordinary mind, in order to protect humans, diligently expanded the Shakya clan,

original: goo ta mar 'khrungs sa stengs 'jig rten 'dir ni sangs rgyas gyur par grag ces thos //
analyzed: goo ta mar 'khrungs sa stengs 'jig rten 'dir ni sangs rgyas gyur par grag ces thos //
translated: And was born as Gautama. It is said that he became a Buddha in this world.

original: skye bo nyon mongs blun zhing rmongs pas ston pa phan 'dogs lags par ma 'tshal grang //
analyzed: skye bo nyon mongs blun zhing rmongs pas ston pa phan 'dogs lags par ma 'tshal grang //
translated: People are afflicted by afflictions, foolish and deluded, not recognizing the beneficial teacher.üîΩWhen, out of desire and hatred, the jewels were stolen from the asura's house,

original: gang tshe 'dod chags zhe sdang gis ni lha min khyim nas rin chen phrogs pa dang // chags pa'i blo gros kyis ni ngan g-yo byas nas sa dag phrogs par gyur kyang ni //
analyzed: gang tshe 'dod chags zhe sdang gis ni lha min khyim nas rin chen phrogs pa dang // chags pa'i blo gros kyis ni ngan g-yo byas nas sa dag phrogs par gyur kyang ni //
translated: And when the earth was taken away through deceitful means with a greedy mind,

original: de tshe khyab 'jug ma grol bzhin du skye bo blun po rnams ni mchod phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: de tshe khyab 'jug ma grol bzhin du skye bo blun po rnams ni mchod phyag 'tshal //
translated: At that time, Vishnu, while not liberated, was worshipped and venerated by foolish people.

original: sangs rgyas nges par rnam grol gyur kyang skye bo phal cher rmongs pas phyag mi 'tshal //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nges par rnam grol gyur kyang skye bo phal cher rmongs pas phyag mi 'tshal //
translated: Even though the Buddha was certainly liberated, most people do not pay homage to him out of confusion.

original: sa 'di rgya mtsho bzhi yi ska rags gtams pa'i ljid kyis ni //
analyzed: sa 'di rgya mtsho bzhi yi ska rags gtams pa'i ljid kyis ni //
translated: This earth, girdled by the four oceans, seems heavy with the weight of

original: lci lci ltar 'dug khyab 'jug byin yang stobs chen sdug bsngal gnas skabs gyur //
analyzed: lci lci ltar 'dug khyab 'jug byin yang stobs chen sdug bsngal gnas skabs gyur //
translated: Vi·π£·πáu‚Äôs burden, but he is in a state of great suffering.

original: thub pa la ni rdul tsam phul bas rgyal po mya ngan med pa yis //
analyzed: thub pa la ni rdul tsam phul bas rgyal po mya ngan med pa yis //
translated: But by offering just a bit of dust to the Sage, King A≈õoka

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor thel gyi 'od zer gos can sa stengs mtha' dag thob //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor thel gyi 'od zer gos can sa stengs mtha' dag thob //
translated: obtained the entire surface of the earth, with its moon-like kings and its mantle of stars.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas phyogs mi 'dzin //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas phyogs mi 'dzin //
translated: I do not take the side of the Buddha,

original: ser skya sogs la mi sdang yang //
analyzed: ser skya sogs la mi sdang yang //
translated: nor do I hate Kapila and the others.

original: gang zhig rigs par ldan pa'i tshig / de nyid ston par yongs su 'dzin //
analyzed: gang zhig rigs par ldan pa'i tshig / de nyid ston par yongs su 'dzin //
translated: But I do accept as a teacher anyone whose words are reasonable.üîΩWhoever is omniscient and

original: 'di ltar su yang rung ste nges par kun mkhyen dang // 'gro la gcig tu phan 'dogs mdzad pa'i lugs che ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar su yang rung ste nges par kun mkhyen dang // 'gro la gcig tu phan 'dogs mdzad pa'i lugs che ba //
translated: whose system is solely for the benefit of the world,

original: de dag blo gros zhib mo'i mig gis btsal nas su //
analyzed: de dag blo gros zhib mo'i mig gis btsal nas su //
translated: I will search for him with the eye of fine intellect.

original: bsten par bya yi gzhan dag mkhas la ci zhig mkho //
analyzed: bsten par bya yi gzhan dag mkhas la ci zhig mkho //
translated: I rely on him, for what need have I of others?

original: gang la skyon kun yod min la //
analyzed: gang la skyon kun yod min la //
translated: He in whom all faults do not exist,

original: yon tan thams cad yod gyur na //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad yod gyur na //
translated: And all good qualities are present,

original: tshangs dang khyab 'jug dbang phyug che //
analyzed: tshangs dang khyab 'jug dbang phyug che //
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Mahesvara,

original: de yang bdag gi ston pa yin //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi ston pa yin //
translated: He is my teacher.üîΩI go for refuge to him,

original: gang la skyon ni mi mnga' zhing //
analyzed: gang la skyon ni mi mnga' zhing //
translated: In whom no faults exist,

original: yon tan @45a * //
analyzed: yon tan @45a * //
translated: And immeasurable good qualities,

original: dpag med mnga' ba dang // thams cad mkhyen dang thugs rje can //üîΩde la bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: dpag med mnga' ba dang // thams cad mkhyen dang thugs rje can // de la bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
translated: Who is omniscient and compassionate.

original: pad+ma kha bye rgyas pa'i 'dab ltar dkyus ring spyan mnga' ba //
analyzed: pad+ma kha bye rgyas pa'i 'dab ltar dkyus ring spyan mnga' ba //
translated: His eyes are long like the petals of an open lotus.

original: bstod pa'i chu klung stong gis rgya mtsho de ltar bstod bgyis pa //
analyzed: bstod pa'i chu klung stong gis rgya mtsho de ltar bstod bgyis pa //
translated: I praise him, the ocean, with a thousand rivers of praise.

original: bdag gi tshig gis bskrun pa'i dge ba cung zad ci mchis pa //
analyzed: bdag gi tshig gis bskrun pa'i dge ba cung zad ci mchis pa //
translated: By the virtue created by these words of mine,üîΩMay all sentient beings be endowed with happiness.

original: des ni sems can thams cad bde ba dag dang ldan gyur cig / lha las phul du byung ba'i bstod pa slob dpon bde byed bdag pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: des ni sems can thams cad bde ba dag dang ldan gyur cig / lha las phul du byung ba'i bstod pa slob dpon bde byed bdag pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The praise in excelsis of the god, composed by the master Manibhadra, is completed.

original: // / rgya gsar gyi mkhan po sarba dzny'a de wa dang / lo ts'a ba bande rin chen mchog gis bsgyur /
analyzed: // / rgya gsar gyi mkhan po sarba dzny'a de wa dang / lo ts'a ba bande rin chen mchog gis bsgyur /
translated: The Indian abbot Sarvaj√±ƒÅdeva and the translator-editor Band√© Rinchen-chok translated and edited it.

original: zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande dpal brtsegs rakshi tas zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande dpal brtsegs rakshi tas zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
